content:
• Thursday, May 31, 2018
  • KNSA

    Top investor files purchases of Kiniksa; shares +8.7% late

    • Recently listed Kiniksa Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KNSA) is up 8.7% in some relatively light after-hours trading.
    • Shortly after today's close, a form 4 filing from James Flynn and affiliated Deerfield funds (possible members of a 10% ownership group) noted a conversion of 385,538 shares of Series C Preferred stock into Class A common stock at the IPO closing, along with purchases of 843,352 shares across four transactions on Tuesday.
    • Shares had dropped below the $18 IPO price on Tuesday; they're quoting at $18.59 after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • EVH

    Evolent Health -1.7% amid price report of 2.8M-share offering

    • Evolent Health (NYSE:EVH) is down 1.7% postmarket after word of a 2.8M-share offering coming at a discount.
    • Shares are likely to be offered by an unknown holder at $19.45-$19.85 each, Bloomberg reports, representing a discount of 2.9% to 4.9% from today's close.
    • The offering's coming via BofA Merrill Lynch.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Beauty -5% as Q1 same-store sales, Q2 guidance disappoint

    • Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) -4.8% after-hours despite beating Q1 earnings expectations, as it guides Q2 earnings and revenues below Wall Street consensus.
    • While Q1 revenues rose 17% Y/Y to $1.54B from $1.31B, comparable-store sales rose 8.1% compared with an 14.3% increase in the year-ago quarter.
    • For Q2, Ulta expects EPS of $2.35-$2.40 vs. $2.48 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of $1.47B-$1.49B vs. $1.49B consensus.
    • But Ulta raises its FY 2018 earnings guidance, now expecting to deliver GAAP EPS growth in the low 20s in terms of percentage, compared with a previous outlook of ~20%, including the impact of $500M in share buybacks.
    • Ulta reaffirms full-year guidance for increasing total sales in the low teens percentage range and achieving comp sales growth of 6%-8%, including the impact of e-commerce.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM | 13 Comments
  • VMW

    VMware +3.1% on Q1 beats, upside revenue guidance

    • VMware (NYSE:VMW) gains 3.1% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 14% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Upside guidance came on earnings call: Q2 has revenue at $2.145B (consensus: $2.085B) and FY19 has revenue of $8.78B (consensus: $8.731B). 
    • Key metrics: License revenue, $774M (+21%); operating cash flow, $110B; FCF, $1.03B. 
    • GAAP net income of $942M included $781M gained from the Pivotal Software IPO.  
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: VMware beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 7 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday -3.1% despite Q1 beats

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) shares drop 3.1% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue guidance with a 29% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Q2 subscription revenue is expected from $557M to $559M. Raised FY guidance puts subscription revenue rom $2.275B to $2.29B (was: $2.265B to $2.28B). 
    • Key metrics: Subscription revenues, $522.1M (+31% Y/Y); operating cash flow, $184.2M; FCF, $135.4M; cash and equivalents, $3.4B; unearned revenue, $1.4B (+18%). 
    • Press release.    
    • Previously: Workday beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • ZUO

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/31/2018)

    • Top gainers: ZUO +7.9%. LULU +6.5%. SNCR +3.1%. PHI +2.6%. VICI +1.7%.
    • Top Losers: GME -3.1%. FULT -2.9%. WDAY -2.6%.  BNS -2.2%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • EVRG-OLD

    Ambac Financial +4.2% on index promotion; IART, EVRG, NAVI changing places

    • Evergy (OTC:EVRG-OLD) -- soon to be the new name of Westar Energy (NYSE:WR) -- will join the S&P 500, replacing Navient (NASDAQ:NAVI).
    • Navient will replace Westar Energy in the S&P MidCap 400, since Westar will have a bigger market cap after acquiring Great Plains Energy (NYSE:GXP).
    • Integra Lifesciences Holdings (NASDAQ:IART) will replace Great Plains in the MidCap 400.
    • Meanwhile, Ambac Financial Group (NASDAQ:AMBC) is up 4.2% after hours after word that it will replace Integra in the SmallCap 600.
    • The moves are effective prior to Tuesday's market open.
    • WR is up 0.8% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 8 Comments
  • COST

    Strong sales growth across markets for Costco

    • Costco (NASDAQ:COST) reports comparable sales growth of 10.2% to sail past the 8.0% expectation of analysts.
    • The retailer delivered a 9.7% comp in the U.S. including gas and saw online sale soar 37% Y/Y. Canada saw a 11.3% jump in comparable sales to nearly match the 11.8% gain across international markets.
    • Net income was up 7.1% Y/y to $750M during the quarter.
    • Shares of Costco are down 1.94% in AH trading. Expect a swing up or down after the conference call update on guidance.
    • Previously: Costco Wholesale beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 13 Comments
  • YEXT

    Yext beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Yext (NYSE:YEXT): Q1 EPS of -$0.11 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $51.1M (+37.8% Y/Y) beats by $1.64M.
    • Shares +2.66%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology Q1 EPS beat, in-line guidance

    • Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) gains 0.05% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS estimates but met on revenue with a 6% Y/Y growth. In-line Q2 guidance has revenue from $600M to $630M (consensus: $621M).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 62.5%; cash and short-term investments, $1.9B; cash flow from operations, $129M; total operating expenses, $250.6M; total liabilities, $578.8M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:45 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • LULU

    Lululemon posts dazzling sales growth

    • Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) reports comparable sales soared 20% in FQ1, including a 62% jump in direct to consumer revenue during the quarter. Comparable store sales were up 8%.
    • The extra sales leverage helped push up the retailer's gross margin rate by 370 bps to +53.1% of sales. Operating margin was 16.1% of sales vs. 12.1% a year ago.
    • "Our first quarter results reflect the ongoing strength of our business and our continued focus on product innovation, global growth, digital acceleration, and, most importantly, investing in our people. Our momentum remains strong and we are optimistic for 2018 and beyond," says COO Stuart Haselden.
    • Guidance from Lululemon also arrived in strong fashion. The company expects full year revenue of $3.04B to $3.075B off a comparable sales increase in the high single digits. EPS of $3.10 to $3.18 is anticipated vs. $3.00 to $3.08 prior and $3.10 consensus.
    • LULU +4.69% AH to $109.98.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 14 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY): Q1 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $618.6M (+28.9% Y/Y) beats by $9.82M.
    • Shares +1.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop sales suffer against Nintendo Switch comparison

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) reports comparable sales fell 5.3% in Q1 to just miss the consensus estimate for a 5.0% drop.
    • Comparable sales were down 2.6% in the U.S. and 11.6% for the international business.
    • New hardware sales decreased 7.9% and new software sales were down 10.6% as both categories came up against a tough category from a year ago when the Nintendo Switch arrived.
    • Digital sales were up 29.6%, excluding the Kongregate business which was sold.
    • Collectibles sales were up 24.4% during the quarter.
    • Looking ahead, GameStop expects full year sales to fall 2.0% to 6.0% and EPS to land in a range of $3.00 to $3.35.
    • GME -4.29% AH to $12.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 45 Comments
  • ONVO

    Organovo Holdings EPS in-line, misses on revenue

    • Organovo Holdings (NASDAQ:ONVO): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 in-line.
    • Revenue of $1.1M (+35.8% Y/Y) misses by $0.22M.
    • Shares +1.52%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • OTTR

    Otter Tail Power -4% as Williams cuts to Sell on rate case outcome

    • Otter Tail Power (OTTR -3.8%) is sharply lower after Williams Capital downgrades shares to Sell from Hold with a $42 price target, citing what appears to be a somewhat disappointing likely rate case outcome in North Dakota.
    • Williams says initial staff testimony for the North Dakota electric base rate case in docket PU-17-398 was filed on May 18, and net staff opinion was for only a 0.6% revenue increase, with the difference in the staff's revenue requirement opinion primarily a result of a recommended 8.31% return on equity compared to OTTR's filing for a 10.3% ROE.
    • The firm says the South Dakota Public Utilities Commission also denied OTTR's request for interim rates in docket EL-18-021.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • FB

    Shareholder reforms fail to pass at Facebook meeting

    • Management proposals prevailed at Facebook's (FB +2%) annual meeting, the company says, in a year where shareholder proposals offered some atypical resolutions following the company's data-privacy scandal.
    • All eight director nominees were elected, Facebook says, while all six shareholder reforms lost, including those addressing voting structure and content oversight.
    • Without vote tallies as of yet, that leaves unknown just how much support the reforms had apart from insiders, who control about 60% of votes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 10 Comments
  • PS

    Pluralsight -3% on stake disclosure

    • ICONIQ Strategic Partners discloses a 13.3% stake in Pluralsight (NASDAQ:PS).
    • Pluralsight shares are down 3% to $21.38.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • ARNC

    Arconic downgraded at Argus on macro, micro challenges

    • Arconic (ARNC -2.3%) is lower after Argus downgrades shares to Hold from Buy, saying all three of the company's business segments - global rolled products, engineered products and solutions, and transportation and construction solutions - face challenges from the rising price of aluminum.
    • ARNC also is confronted by company-specific problems, including the role its products played in the fire at London's Grenfell Tower, which Argus says has sparked "unfavorable" and daily press coverage.
    • The firm also notes ARNC's worrisome stock chart, as the 50-day moving average recently dipped below the 200-day moving average.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    Sears plan: Fewer stores, more initiatives

    • Sears Holdings (SHLD) discloses that employees at 15 Kmart and 48 Sears stores were informed that the stores would be closed in early September.
    • The company said earlier today that a total of 72 underperforming stores would be closing.
    • As part of its earnings presentation slideshow, Sears pointed to the auto service partnership with Amazon, a partnership with GasBuddy and the Lease It program with Citi as important initiatives in the company's drive toward profitable growth.
    • Sears earnings call slides
    • Shares of Sears are down 12.77% on the day.
    • Previously: Another EBITDA loss at Sears (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • PCAR

    Paccar -3% as Goldman downgrades amid dim view of trucking stocks

    • Paccar (PCAR -3.2%) plummets after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy with a $74 price target, noting that while U.S. truck market indicators including rates and loads have stabilized at new cycle highs thanks to strong freight demand and a tight trucking labor market, the load-truck ratio - a "critical leading indicator" - has fallen 30% in the past four months.
    • Goldman's Jerry Revich says he is concerned about a deterioration in the U.S. truck cyclical outlook in the next year, and says PCAR's operating leverage was lower than his target this cycle.
    • While Revich downgrades the broader machinery sector to Neutral from Attractive, citing an expected peak in truck production in the next year, he remains bullish on commodity industries such as oil, gas, mining and power generation, where machinery capital expenditure is ~50% below normal levels on its way to a recovery; he maintains Buy ratings on Caterpillar (CAT -2%), Deere (DE -2.6%), Trimble (TRMB -3%) and Agco (AGCO -1.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • PTNR

    Partner Communications starts 200M-shekel buyback

    • Along with earnings today, Israel's Partner Communications (PTNR +4.9%) announced a share repurchase plan.
    • The plan authorizes buybacks of up to 200M shekels (about $56.1M) of ordinary shares on the Tel Aviv exchange.
    • That starts June 4 and lasts until May 30, 2019.
    • It will be implemented in multiple tranches, starting with the buyback of up to 50M shekels worth (about $14M).
    • Shares are at a two-week high in Nasdaq trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • BA

    Boeing CEO downplays steel tariffs, 'hopeful' U.S. will avert trade war

    • Boeing (BA -1.6%) CEO Dennis Muilenburg says "we don't see any immediate or significant impact" from U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, and is optimistic that the U.S. and China will work together to hammer out fair trade terms.
    • "We remain hopeful that the U.S. and China will reach a conclusion that is productive for both countries," Muilenberg tells TheStreet.com, noting "the world will need 41,000 new airplanes and more than 7,000 of them will be in China. We are doing well in China, and our Chinese customers are very important to us."
    • The stakes are high for Boeing, as ~70% of the company's planes delivered in 2017 were to countries outside the U.S., including 22% to China.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPTN

    Analysts size up SpartanNash amid rally

    • Wolfe Research updates on SpartanNash (SPTN +6.3%) following the company' Q1 earnings report.
    • The firm keeps a Peer Perform rating amid what it calls a very tough operating climate with a strong management team.
    • Wolfe's summary on SPTN: "The business continues to move in the right direction with the Food Distribution segment leading the charge while the Retail business remains held back by the ongoing challenging climate. The equity vaulted forward on Wednesday, making up much of the pullback in February post 4Q results, however, we don’t believe the operating backdrop nor the trajectory of the business to have meaningfully changed despite the volatility in the equity. We continue to believe the team is making the right decisions and is seeing slow and steady progress in certain areas, partly offset by the vagaries of inflation, rising transportation costs, and an ongoing challenging backdrop."
    • BMO Capital is also out with a note on SpartanNash, pointing to the strong momentum across its business segments.
    • Shares of SpartanNash are up over 30% since the earnings report earlier this week.
    • Previously: SpartanNash beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (May 29)
    • Previously: Sales mix impacts bottom line at SpartanNash (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYNL

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (05/31/2018)

    • Gainers: SYNL +7%. NGL +5%.
    • Losers: CLD -10%. WMLP-OLD -9%. HWKN -7%. MBII -6%. ACET -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • KTOV

    FDA OKs Kitov's Consensi; shares up 6%

    • The FDA approves Kitov Pharma's (KTOV +6%) Consensi (amlodipine and celecoxib) for the treatment of osteoarthritis pain and hypertension.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 16 Comments
  • PTNR

    Partner Communications up 3% despite miss

    • Partner Communications (PTNR +3.6%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 2.9% Y/Y to NIS 826M, of which services revenues of NIS 625M (-2% Y/Y) & equipment revenues of NIS 201M (+23% Y/Y).
    • Cellular Segment: Total cellular revenue of NIS 644M (+2% Y/Y); services revenues NIS 466M (-5% Y/Y) & equipment revenues of NIS 178M (+23% Y/Y).
    • Fixed-Line Segment: Total Fixed-Line revenue of NIS 225M (+6% Y/Y); services revenues NIS 202M (+4% Y/Y) & equipment revenues of NIS 23M (+28% Y/Y).
    • Q1 overall margins: Gross declined 185 bps to 16.7%; Operating declined 921 bps to 3.9%; Adj. EBITDA declined 1000 bps to 21% also, for Cellular: Operating declined 841 bps to 3.4% & Adj. EBITDA declined 869 bps to 20.8%; Fixed-line: Operating declined 971 bps to 4.4% & Adj. EBITDA declined 1,108 bps to 19.1%.
    • Total OPEX was NIS 498M (-4% Q/Q), decline mainly reflected higher periodic payroll & related expenses in Q4 & a decline in marketing expenses.
    • Cellular Subscribers were 2,667 (+9% Y/Y); Quarterly Cellular Churn rate declined 100 bps to 8.8% & Monthly Average Revenue per Cellular User of NIS 58 (-3% Y/Y).
    • Adjusted free cash flow (before interest) was NIS 21M (-83% Y/Y); Net Debt amounted to NIS 919M (-35.1% Y/Y) & Cash & equivalents of NIS 403M (-53.5% Q/Q).
    • Previously: Partner Communication reports Q1 results (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • I

    Intelsat jumps again as CTIA leans on FCC over mid-band progress

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is marking another day of strong gains, up 17.2%, as its proposals to monetize mid-band spectrum get more traction, this time with help from the CTIA.
    • The wireless trade group is urging the FCC to move forward on opportunities in mid-band, including finalizing rules for 3.5-GHz spectrum ("Citizens Broadband Radio Service") and to set an aggressive timeline to clear "hundreds of megahertz" in the C-Band (3.7 GHz-4.2 GHz).
    • Intelsat posted a similar double-digit jump at the start of May when the FCC elected to study sharing C-band spectrum with wireless companies, a proposal pushed by Intelsat along with SES (SGBAF -0.4%) and Intel (INTC -0.3%).
    • The response from the wireless industry has been key, with a question arising as to whether carriers would share with satellite firms or seek the spectrum entirely for themselves.
    • Previously: SES, Intelsat move as Morgan Stanley embraces C-band proposal (May. 29 2018)
    • Previously: FCC to study C-band sharing; Intelsat +18.6%, Intel +2.6% (May. 01 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • MARPS

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (05/31/2018)

    • Gainers: MARPS +13%. ONDK +7%. YRIV +7%. OPHC +7%. LOOP +6%.
    • Losers: IHT -16%. DB -7%. CHMI -6%. CIA -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDGL

    Midday Gainers / Losers (05/31/2018)

    • Gainers: MDGL +141%. VKTX +68%. TPIV +24%. SESN +25%. CRIS +22%. VTVT +21%. JILL +21%. BOXL +19%. AXON +17%. I +17%.
    • Losers: SCPH -29%. CLSD -26%. CBK -25%. GLNG -22%. OGEN -21%. CODX -18%. GES -18%. IHT -16%. AEZS -15%. QTM-OLD -15%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MEIP

    Mid-stage MDS study of MEI Pharma's pracinostat to continue as planned; shares up 2%

    • Based on the outcome of a planned interim analysis, the open-label Phase 2 study assessing MEI Pharma's (MEIP +2.4%) pracinostat plus azacitidine (Celgene's VIDAZA) in higher-risk myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) patients will continue as planned.
    • The specific threshold for continuation was patient retention. At data cutoff, 10% of patients discontinued treatment due to adverse events in the first three cycles of therapy, a rate consistent with azacitidine alone. Enrollment will now be expanded to 60 MDS patients.
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is June 2020.
    • MEI out-licensed pracinostat, an oral histone deacetylase inhibitor, to Swiss drug maker Helsinn in August 2016. Helsinn is primarily responsible for development and commercialization costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNAP

    Citron sees 55% upside in Snap; shares +5.8%

    • Snap (SNAP +5.8%) has hit a session high after Citron Research starts coverage on the stock with a price target of $17, a heavy 55% upside implied from yesterday's close.
    • "Time to spook the shorts who have overstayed their welcome," the firm says while acknowledging the stock has been a "wonderful short" over four months.
    • "Staying short a stock where negative catalysts and news flow are baked in is a recipe for disaster that is often coupled with an inability to look past the headlines," Citron says.
    • News flow suggests a contrarian view, Citron says, noting ad impressions are jumping, Snapchat is still tops among teens, it's escaped privacy scandals elsewhere in social media, and expectations can hardly get worse after four out of five quarters have turned up disappointing.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 47 Comments
  • CWH

    Camping World lower on tariff concerns

    • Shares of Camping World (CWH -2.9%) follow the broad RV sector lower on concerns over the impact of steel and aluminum tariffs imposed by the Trump Administration.
    • Earlier today, the Camping World board declared a special cash dividend of $0.0732 per share.
    • Previously: RV sector drops after tariffs enacted (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 16 Comments
  • SAEX

    SAExploration +3% after applying for ANWR seismic work

    • SAExploration (SAEX +3.5%) is joining two Alaska Native corporations in a partnership to apply to conduct extensive seismic testing next winter in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, the first step toward drilling for oil and gas at the site, the Washington Post reports.
    • SAEX says the partnership is "dedicated to minimizing the effect of our operations on the environment,” and would deploy sleds, smaller vehicles and biodegradable lubricants and would construct ice roads.
    • But the U.S. Interior Department’s Fish and Wildlife Service says the permit application - the only one filed so far - failed to provide studies about the effects of the seismic work and equipment on wildlife, the tundra and the aquatic conditions in ANWR.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • GHM

    More on Graham's Q4 results

    • Graham (GHM -0.7%) reported Q4 net sales of $22.18M (-13.4% Y/Y). Sales by Industry: Refining $7.9M (+49% Y/Y), chemical/petrochemical $3.6M (-92% Y/Y), power $3.2M (-50% Y/Y) and other commercial, industrial & defense $7.4M (-34% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Margins: Gross declined by 350 bps to 22.8%, operating declined by 600 bps to 3.8% and EBITDA declined by 580 bps to 6.3%.
    • Q4 orders grew by 79% Y/Y to $43.5M of which orders from US reflect 81% and International reflect 19%.
    • Backlog was $117.9M as of 31 March 2018, up 30% Y/Y. Company expects 55-60% of backlog to convert into sales in next 12 months.
    • FY19 Guidance: Revenue $90-95M; gross margin 24-25%, SG&A expenses $18-18.75M; tax rate 20-22%.
    • Previously: Graham beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • FCAU

    Fiat Chrysler, Waymo expand partnership with 65K vehicles

    • Fiat Chrysler (FCAU +3.1%) and Google’s (GOOG +2.3%)(GOOGL +2.6%) Waymo expand their self-driving vehicle partnership with plans to roll out over 62K autonomous Chrysler Pacifica hybrid minivans.
    • The deal might include licensing Waymo tech and services for incorporation in FCA vehicles. 
    • Waymo is currently testing its tech in 600 modified Chrysler Pacifica hybrid minivans. 
    • Waymo plans to launch a self-driving vehicle ride-hail service later this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 30 Comments
  • DSGX

    Descartes Systems slides 6% due to weak margins

    • Descartes Systems (DSGX -6.1%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 22.9% Y/Y to $67M, of which services revenues was $57.8M (+24% Y/Y); professional services & other revenues of $7.3M & license revenues of $1.9M.
    • Q1 overall margins: Gross declined 100 bps to 72%; operating declined 240 bps to 14.5%; Adj. EBITDA declined 200 bps to 33% & Net margin declined 100 bps to 10%.
    • Cash was $36.2M (+3.1% Q/Q) & CFO of $18.9M (+15% Y/Y).
    • “Increasingly demanding consumer buying expectations continue to impact the B2B market. Companies need to adapt to this increased complexity to remain competitive,” said Edward J. Ryan, CEO.
    • Previously: Descartes Systems misses by $0.02, beats on revenue (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • GM

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (05/31/2018)

    • Gainers: GM +11%.
    • Losers: THO -6%. NAKD -6%. WGO -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • ALIM

    Reimbursement for Alimera's Iluvien set in Spain; shares up 2%

    • Alimera Sciences (ALIM +2.1%) announces that the Spanish Ministry of Health has approved pricing and reimbursement for ILUVIEN (fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant) for the treatment of vision impairment associated with chronic diabetic macular edema.
    • ILUVIEN will be distributed in country by Brill.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • CIEN

    Ciena announces intent to acquire Packet Design

    • Ciena (CIEN -2.1%) has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire privately-held Packet Design, LLC, a provider of network performance management software focused on Layer 3 network optimization, topology and route analytics.
    • All other terms of the agreement are confidential.
    • The transaction is expected to close during Ciena’s Q318 and is subject to customary closing conditions.
    • Previously: Ciena -8.4% on mixed Q2 results (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Benchmark praises Zynga's Gram Games deal as shares rise for second day

    • Zynga (ZNGA +2.7%) is building on gains that day after it sealed a $250M deal to buy mobile developer Gram Games.
    • It's just "another swimmingly boring deal that drives considerable EBITDA growth while leveraging strength within established genres," says Benchmark's Mike Hickey, who's raising his price target to $5 from $4.36 (implying another 13% upside). He's praising a solid balance sheet along with an emerging pipeline and continued cost cuts. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Bookings should keep growing with new game launches and there's M&A potential to drive EBITDA as well, he writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • MTL

    Mechel PAO board elect not to pay dividends on ordinary shares

    • Mechel PAO (MTL +0.9%) board elect not to pay an annual dividend with respect to ordinary shares.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • GT

    Goodyear to test 'intelligent' tires for EVs and AVs

    • Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT -1.3%) says it's extending the company's worldwide innovation network to include Mcity.
    • Mcity is the University of Michigan-led public-private partnership aimed at advancing connected and automated vehicles and technologies.

  • NOK

    Nokia wraps digital health sale, names new Technologies president

    • Nokia (NOK -3%) has completed the sale of its digital health unit, wrapping up a quick reversal from a business it entered in a big way two years ago.
    • It's sold the former Withings unit to Eric Carreel, the co-founder and former chairman of Withings. Nokia had paid €170M for the business two years ago but took a €141M writedown on it in October.
    • The digital health unit was part of Nokia Technologies, whose licensing businesses are not affected by the sale.
    • With the transaction complete, it's changing up leadership at Nokia Technologies. Chief Legal Officer Maria Varsellona will take on the additional role of president, as current president Gregory Lee is leaving the company.
    • Lee steps down from Nokia Group Leadership immediately and will leave the company after a transition.
    • "Gregory came to Nokia, made a clear-eyed assessment of our consumer business and incubation activities, and took the bold decision to refocus Nokia Technologies on licensing," says CEO Rajeev Suri. "As part of that effort, he assessed strategic options for Digital Health, which led to the sale of that business. Given that, we have agreed that his work at Nokia is done."

    Genprex up 23% on planned expansion of Oncoprex trials

    • Genprex (GNPX +23.2%) inks a Master Services Agreement with regulatory services provider WIRB-Copernicus Group (WCG) under which it will serve as the Institutional Review Board (IRB) and Institutional Biosafety Committee (IBC) of record for new clinical trial sites that the company plans to add to its Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing lead candidate Oncoprex, in combination with Roche's Tarceva (erlotinib), in patients non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
    • Oncoprex is an immunogene therapy consisting of a gene called TUSC2 that is encapsulated in a positively charged lipid nanovesicle.   • Brent-WTI spread breaks above $11/bbl, highest since 2015

    • Brent crude oil reverses earlier losses to move higher while U.S. WTI sinks into the red, sending the premium of Brent to WTI ballooning past $11/bbl for the first time since March 2015; currently, Brent +0.5% at $77.90/bbl, WTI -1.6% at $67.14/bbl.
    • The spread has doubled in less than a month, as a lack of pipeline capacity in the U.S. has trapped a sizable amount of production inland.
    • Pipelines out of Cushing, Okla., running to refining and export hubs on the Gulf Coast largely are running at capacity, forcing the spread to widen to discourage storage or to bring on other forms of more expensive transportation.
    • In Midland, Tex., crude from the Permian priced as much as $12.50/bbl below WTI yesterday, Financial Times reports, making the discount to international markets more than $20/bbl.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
